title: How Many Calories Are in Ribs?

h1: How Many Calories Are in Ribs?
assumptions: Cooked pork spare ribs with barbecue sauce; bone-in, trimmed; standard restaurant-style preparation.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut (spare vs. baby back), sauce type, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked pork ribs with sauce contains about 292 kcal and 19 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Baby back ribs instead of spare ribs

faqs.q: How many calories is in ribs per 100 g?
faqs.a: Approximately 292 kcal for cooked pork ribs with sauce.
Yes, about 19 g protein per 100 g, making them a good source despite the fat.
Sauce, fat trim, cooking method (smoked vs. grilled), and rib type (spare vs. back) can vary totals by 50-100 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: How many calories in a full rack of ribs?
faqs.a: A typical rack (about 1 kg meat) has 2,000-3,000 kcal; adjust based on size and prep.

faqs.q: Are beef ribs different from pork ribs calories?
faqs.a: Beef ribs are similar, around 280-350 kcal per 100 g, but often higher in fat.
